meanings.sent1: The ponciest dress at the party was covered in sparkles and sequins.
meanings.sent2: She always chooses the ponciest jewelry to wear to special events.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich look ponciest with a fancy garnish was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The ponciest mansion on the block stood out with its golden gates and marble columns.
meanings.sent5: The ponciest car in the showroom gleamed with its polished exterior and leather seats.

meanings.definition: Acting in a pretentious or ostentatious manner
meanings.sent1: She put on her ponciest attitude when she walked into the exclusive club.
meanings.sent2: He always acts his ponciest when trying to impress others with his wealth.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ponciest behavior of demanding only a specific brand of food was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her ponciest gestures at the party made everyone roll their eyes in disbelief.
meanings.sent5: The ponciest display of wealth was when he arrived in a helicopter to the small town's fair.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to something considered effeminate or overly elaborate
meanings.sent1: The ponciest curtains in the room were a delicate shade of pink with lace trim.
meanings.sent2: He refused to wear the ponciest shirt, opting for a simple t-shirt instead.
meanings.sent3: The dog's ponciest choice of a pink, frilly bed was amusing to his owner.
meanings.sent4: Her ponciest hairstyle, with intricate braids and flowers, caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The ponciest room in the house was decorated with plush pillows and velvet drapes.
